1.text: Let your brownies cool for 1-2 hours before you cut them.

2.text: Use a serrated knife to make the cuts.

3.text: Make 1 vertical cut in the middle of the brownies to divide them in half.

4.text: Divide each half in half again by making another cut through the middle.

5.text: Make 1-3 horizontal cut to divide the strips down the center.

6.text: Use a plastic disposable knife for clean, even cuts.

7.text: Trim about 1⁄6–1⁄4 in (0.42–0.64 cm) off the edges of your brownies.

8.text: Make notches around the edges of the brownies at 2 in (5.1 cm) intervals.

9.text: Dip your plastic knife in hot water to make smooth, even cuts.

10.text: Cut your brownies vertically at each of the marks you made.

11.text: Cut your brownies horizontally at each of the notches.

12.text: Use a 12-cavity brownie bar pan to bake brownies without cutting them.

13.text: Try using a muffin pan if you don't have a brownie bar pan.

14.text: Try a mini silicone brownie mold to easily make bite-sized brownies.

15.text: Use a brownie divider set if you want pre-sliced brownies.
